intro: Archeria traversii var. australis, commonly known as the Australian archer's glove, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats across southern Australia.
